FacilityName: City of Steubenville, Wastewater Treatment Plant

_prev_prog_2.Description: The chlorine storage and feed rooms have alarms and a check for leaks mannually is done daily

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The City of Steubenville has been committed to the safety of its ewmployees and residents.  At the wastewater treatment facility the city has provided the employees with all the necessary training and a policy on how to handle emergencies.  The wastewater treatment plant collects and treats domestic waste.  There are no industrial users of this facility.  The treatment process includes the use of chlorine for the disinfection of the treated waste to reduce the amount of fecal coliform entering the Ohio River.  The plant usually has 8000 pounds maximum to 2000 pounds minimum stored at the plant at any one time.A description and summary of worst case scenario and alternative release scenario and there offsite impact are as follows:

In May of 1998 the plant did have an accidental releasse of cchlorine gas.  Although the amount released was very small we did have an employee that was injured in the accident.  There were no offsite injuries or evacuations that occurred.  
Our emergency response program is coordinated with the local LEPC and through our local 911 system.  This will notify all local emergency responders.  All employees that work with chlorine have had training.  They have had Chlorine Awareness Classes, Operational Classes, and Technical Training for the handling of chlorine gas.  With these classes the employees have completed the level of training as a Hazardous Materials Technician which would make them our first responders in the event of an accident.  In 1999 they received a refresher course which the city requires.  The city has had 3 emergency drills hel

d at the plant.  In our policy at the plant and on file with the LEPC is the evacuation areas for 8 different release scenarios.
By the end of the year 2000 the city wil not be usiing chlorine gas as a disinfection agent.  We will switch our process to sodium hypochlorite for disinfection and sodium bisulfite for dechlorination.
